title: House to Vote on Infrastructure Bill, Dropping Original Schedule
sub_head: Democratic leaders are still trying to lock down support to pass healthcare, education and climate-change measure
body:
WASHINGTON—Top House Democrats moved to bring up a roughly $1 trillion infrastructure bill for a vote Friday, abandoning a longstanding arrangement with progressives to first pass a separate education, healthcare and climate package as the party still struggled to unify around that proposal.
The scheduled vote on the public works legislation, which passed the Senate earlier this summer with broad bipartisan support, would be followed by an initial procedural vote on the roughly $2 trillion social-spending plan. Leaders didn’t schedule a vote on the social-spending plan itself.
